intro: Brassica oleracea subvar. nivea, commonly known as cauliflower, is a cultivar of the cabbage family characterized by its dense, white curds. The plant is an annual or biennial, depending on the climate, and typically grows to a height of 40–100 cm. Its leaves are dark green and slightly pubescent, forming a rosette around the central inflorescence. The edible part consists of the undeveloped flower buds, which are harvested before they open. This variety is widely cultivated for its nutritional value and use in various cuisines worldwide.
